2.text:
How can I find out about Bills going through
Parliament?

6.text:
Go to services.parliament.uk/bills
This will take you to the ‘Bills before

17.text:
Parliament’ page.
This page lists all Bills currently before

23.text:
Parliament.
Each individual Bill has its own page with

28.text:
explanatory notes and amendments.
If you scroll down the page you will find

34.text:
that all Bills are listed in alphabetical
order.

40.text:
The red ‘L’ or green ‘C’ indicate
which House the Bill is currently in; the

46.text:
House of Lords or the House of Commons.
If you’re looking for a particular Bill

51.text:
you can filter the full list by choosing from
the search options at the top of the page.

57.text:
Select the type of bill you’re looking for
and click ‘go.’

62.text:
If you’re not sure of the type of Bill you’re
looking for, you can search the list alphabetically.

70.text:
When you’ve found the Bill you’re looking
for you can click the link in the title. This

79.text:
will take you to the individual Bill's page.
From here; you can see the progress of the

86.text:
Bill at a glance. This is indicated by the
black circle on the chart. You can also find

92.text:
out the latest events regarding this Bill
and what’s coming next.

96.text:
If you’d like to download the latest Bill
to your device just click of the PDF download

102.text:
link.
For more information about the stages of the

105.text:
Bill or to access all the Bill documents click
on the links on the menu on the left hand
